exercises.setup_notes: Position the cable at a low setting and use a bar attachment. Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead.
exercises.execution_notes: Bend and extend the elbows while keeping the arms overhead. Ensure the cable provides tension throughout the range of motion.
exercises.tier_reasons: Provides high tension in the stretched position, feels good, and allows for simple progression. Validated by a 2023 study showing 40% more triceps growth than press downs.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Long head, due to the overhead position providing a deep stretch.
exercises.scientific_insights: 2023 study found overhead extensions caused about 40% more triceps growth than press downs.
exercises.selection_reason: This exercise is selected as an S-Tier exercise for triceps, specifically targeting the long head due to the overhead position.  The 2023 study supporting its effectiveness aligns perfectly with the user's intermediate experience level, where focusing on optimal exercises is key. The overhead position ensures a deep stretch, promoting muscle growth, and the simple progression makes it suitable for continued improvement.

exercises.setup_notes: Use a barbell, grip slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
exercises.execution_notes: Lower the bar to the chest, press back up.
exercises.tier_reasons: Great for overload, consistent tension, but long head not fully engaged.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Medial and lateral heads, due to pressing motion.
exercises.selection_reason: This A-Tier exercise complements the Overhead Cable Triceps Extension by targeting the medial and lateral heads of the triceps.  Its suitability for overload aligns with the intermediate user's need for progressive resistance training. While the long head isn't fully engaged, the overall triceps activation makes it a valuable addition to the routine.

exercises.execution_notes: Ensure a deep stretch on the pecs with high tension throughout the range of motion. Maintain a stable position to enhance mind-muscle connection.
exercises.tier_reasons: Provides a deep stretch with high tension, smooth resistance profile, easy to overload, safer to push to failure.
exercises.additional_notes: Find a machine that feels good at your gym for optimal results.
exercises.selection_reason: This S-Tier chest exercise is chosen for its ability to provide a deep stretch and high tension, crucial for muscle growth. The smooth resistance profile and ease of overload are ideal for an intermediate user. The machine provides stability, enhancing mind-muscle connection and reducing the risk of injury compared to free weights.

exercises.execution_notes: Perform similar to flat dumbbell press but with an incline.
exercises.tier_reasons: Same benefits as flat dumbbell press with added upper pec emphasis.
exercises.selection_reason: This A-Tier exercise targets the upper pectorals, providing a balanced chest workout. The use of dumbbells allows for a greater range of motion and a deeper stretch compared to the barbell incline press, promoting better muscle activation and growth.  It complements the Machine Chest Press, which focuses more on the overall chest.

exercises.setup_notes: Sit down to increase stability and ensure all tension is applied directly to the pecs.
exercises.execution_notes: Perform fly movement with cables, ensuring a big stretch on the pecs with high tension.
exercises.tier_reasons: Provides a big stretch with high tension, stable, smooth tension throughout the range of motion.
exercises.additional_notes: This is currently the favorite chest isolation movement.
exercises.selection_reason: This S-Tier isolation exercise is included to fully target the pectorals. The seated position ensures stability and maximizes tension on the pecs, promoting a good pump and mind-muscle connection. The smooth tension throughout the range of motion makes it ideal for an intermediate user.

exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell or dumbbells at shoulder height.
exercises.execution_notes: Press the weight overhead until arms are fully extended, then slowly lower back to starting position.
exercises.selection_reason: This exercise is added to complete the workout by targeting the shoulders, a muscle group specified in the user's preferences.  The overhead press is a compound movement that effectively works the deltoids, contributing to overall upper body strength and development.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, arms extended to the sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Make small circles forward for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, arms relaxed at sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Roll shoulders forward in a circular motion for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Clasp hands behind back, gently straighten arms.
Raise one arm overhead, bend elbow, and gently pull elbow toward head with other hand.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Hold for 15 seconds, repeat 2 times per arm.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet together, arms at sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Jump, spreading legs and raising arms overhead.
Bring knees up towards chest, alternating legs.
